used to talk about the real price or cost of something that a market decides, rather than one calculated or fixed, for example by a government
OPEC self-interest will ensure us of oil at market prices.
the price of something calculated in relation to what buyers are willing to pay at a particular time, rather than in some other way
measures forcing banks to value assets at market prices, rather than at their original cost
